result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ANTHONY A WILLIAMS in court.  Attorney Scott S. Schlough in court for ANTHONY A WILLIAMS. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1; however, court acquiesces to DAGP for 24 months and plea is not accepted at this time. 
Count 3, Defendant enters no contest plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts plea as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Remaining counts DRI. 

Court orders defendant to pay restitution through DA's Office per DAGP agreement - 
$1115.18 + $115.52 = $1230.70, joint and several with Kaitlin Gadke in 22CF95
